Key Match Events: Miami Heat was dominated by the Indiana Pacers with a final score of 128-115.
Jimmy Butler scored just nine points with two rebounds, four assists, and two steals in 27 minutes in Miami’s 13-point loss to the Pacers.
Post-Match Reflections: Jimmy Butler commented that he doesn’t have any joy playing for the Heat anymore and hinted at a possible departure.
Heat president Pat Riley released a statement that they won’t trade the six-time All-Star, but there’s still a non-zero chance they move him before the Feb. 6 trade deadline.
